private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels: A, E, I.
I can pick or place exactly one top block at a time.
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so that they form a single stack with L on the table and A on top, following the global ordering.

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L.
I can pick or place exactly one top block at a time.
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so that they form a single stack with L on the table and A on top, following the global ordering.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent-specific capabilities and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver that achieves the global stacking goal.

public_information: There are 12 uniquely labeled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J K L.
Only top blocks of each stack can be moved.
Agents move one block at a time and actions are atomic pick-and-place of a single top block.
One agent may manipulate only vowels: A, E, I.
The other agent may manipulate only consonants: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L.
Initial configuration: stack1 bottom-to-top I, H, L, A, J. stack2 bottom-to-top F, E, K, G, C, B, D.
Goal configuration: a single stack with L on the table and above it K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A with A on top.

pddl.system_prompt: You are a block-manipulation expert constrained to moving only vowel-labeled blocks (A, E, I). Analyze the public environment description and your private abilities. Do not emit PDDL. Instead, provide: 1) a concise list of which top blocks you can legally move at the start, 2) the kinds of operations you can perform (pick, place, constraints), 3) short natural-language action templates you expect to be able to execute (for example: 'move A from X to Y when A is clear and Y is clear'), and 4) any assumptions or missing information you need to coordinate with the other agent or the orchestrator.
pddl.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} This is the shared global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal} Provide the requested analysis in natural language without producing PDDL. Focus on the legal local moves you can perform and on clarifying dependencies with the consonant agent.

pddl.system_prompt: You are a block-manipulation expert constrained to moving only consonant-labeled blocks (B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L). Analyze the public environment description and your private abilities. Do not emit PDDL. Instead, provide: 1) a concise list of which top blocks you can legally move at the start, 2) the kinds of operations you can perform (pick, place, constraints), 3) short natural-language action templates you expect to be able to execute (for example: 'move B from X to Y when B is clear and Y is clear'), and 4) any assumptions or missing information you need to coordinate with the other agent or the orchestrator.
pddl.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} This is the shared global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal} Provide the requested analysis in natural language without producing PDDL. Focus on the legal local moves you can perform and on clarifying dependencies with the vowel agent.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and in preparing problems for the FastDownwards planner. You must integrate the natural-language analyses from the two agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem file that together encode the block rearrangement task and are suitable for FastDownwards. Keep the agents' actions distinct by naming or prefixing actions and predicates so it is clear which agent can perform which action (for example, use action names vowel-pick, vowel-place, consonant-pick, consonant-place or include an agent-type argument). Use only STRIPS-compatible constructs and common FastDownwards requirements. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure initial state encodes the exact stacks given in the environment and the goal encodes the single final stack with L on the table and A on top. Resolve any ambiguities by asking no further questions: prefer conservative modeling that preserves agent-specific move constraints.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the following agent analyses and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards. The two agent reports are provided below. First report (vowel_agent): {pddl_vowel_agent} Second report (consonant_agent): {pddl_consonant_agent} Global goal to encode: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Public environment description: {environment->public_information} Provide a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file, keep actions of the two agents distinct, and ensure the PDDL is executable by FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
